title: smart bengal hackathon
description: World’s biggest open platform for the innovators or entrepreneurs of tomorrow to start today towards a smarter Bengal

description-cards.ingenious: Harnessing creativity and expertise of students, academicians and visionaries

description-cards.collaborative: Crowdsourcing intelligence for improving governance and quality of life

description-cards.empowering: Enabling possibilities and enhancing opportunities for citizens to deliver innovative solutions to India’s daunting problems

about: Smart Bengal Hackathon 2023 is a statewide initiative to provide engineering and school students to solve some of the common problems we face in our daily life, and thus inculcate a culture of product innovation and a mindset of real time problem solving.

themes.title: Tourism
themes.description: A solution/idea that can boost the current situation of the tourism industries including hotels, travel and others.

themes.title: Renewable/ sustainable Energy
themes.description: Innovative ideas that help manage and generate renewable /sustainable sources more efficiently.

themes.title: Blockchain & Cybersecurity
themes.description: Provide ideas in a decentralized and distributed ledger technology used to store digital information that powers cryptocurrencies and NFTs and can radically change multiple sectors.

themes.title: Smart Education
themes.description: Smart education,a concept that describes learning in digital age. It enables learners to learn more effectively, efficiently, flexibly and comfortably.

themes.title: Disaster Management
themes.description: Disaster management includes ideas related to risk mitigation, Planning and management before, after or during a disaster.

themes.title: Toys
themes.description: Challenge your creative mind to conceptualize and develop unique toys and games based on our civilization, history, and culture etc.

themes.title: Miscellaneous
themes.description: Technology ideas in tertiary sectors like Hospitality, Financial Services, Entertainment and Retail.

themes-tagline: No problem is too big... No idea is too small

theme-card-data.desc: Creating intelligent devices to improve commutation sector.
There is a need to design drones and robots that can solve some of the pressing challenges of India such as handling medical emergencies, search and rescue operations, etc.
Disaster management includes ideas related to risk mitigation, Planning and management before, after or during a disaster.
Smart education,a concept that describes learning in digital age. It enables learners to learn more effectively, efficiently, flexibly and comfortably.
Ideas focused on the intelligent use of resources for transforming and advancements of technology with combining the artificial intelligence to explore more various sources and get valuable insights.
Submit your ideas to address the growing pressures on the city’s resources, transport networks, and logistic infrastructure.
Solutions could be in the form of waste segregation, disposal, and improve sanitization system.
Innovative ideas that help manage and generate renewable /sustainable sources more efficiently.
Provide ideas in a decentralized and distributed ledger technology used to store digital information that powers cryptocurrencies and NFTs and can radically change multiple sectors.
Ideas that can boost fitness activities and assist in keeping fit.
Developing solutions, keeping in mind the need to enhance the primary sector of India - Agriculture and to manage and process our agriculture produce.
Cutting-edge technology in these sectors continues to be in demand. Recent shifts in healthcare trends, growing populations also present an array of opportunities for innovation.
Technology ideas in tertiary sectors like Hospitality, Financial Services, Entertainment and Retail.

problemStatementTitle: Create a smart farming system to increase agricultural yields and decrease waste. This can involve enhancing irrigation, fertilization, and pest control procedures through the use of data analysis, machine learning, and IoT technologies.

Create a smart transportation network to ease traffic and boost performance. This can involve developing real-time traffic control systems, electric automobiles, or bike-sharing initiatives, as well as models for predicting traffic.

Enhance rural  Bengal' s access to high-quality medical care. This could involve establishing mobile health clinics, constructing telemedicine platforms, or applying AI to enhance disease diagnosis and treatment planning in rural locations.

As Pesticides can contaminate our food, harm pollinators, and threaten our ecosystems. Beyond direct toxicity, pesticides can significantly reduce, change the behavior of, or destroy populations of plants and animals. These effects can ripple up and down food chains, causing what is known as a trophic.  Exposure and ingesting pesticides have been linked to causing many diseases such as hormone imbalances, cancer,asthma,headaches and inflammation due to the toxic load it adds to your body. Pesticides play a major role in the production of fruits and vegetables. Mainly pesticides are used to flourish the growth of fruits, but there is a level of safe consumption of pesticides. So that optimal solution is needed to detect and monitor the pesticides in the fruits and vegetables the common man is consuming. In order  to protect the human  against  these harmful effects of  pesticide , a Novel solution  is required to be developed  in order to detect and monitor the % level of pesticide  in fruits, vegetables  available in the market automatically .

Unlike that in the past, today, information is all over the place and itself has created an entangled jungle of information sources and destinations -  This is our new problem in the era of  advanced Artificial Intelligence (specially with tube videos and social media platforms very active) . How do one differentiate a real information with a shadowy one and make sure not to fall on the wrong side? Social aggregator platforms have already put up forces, however also falls in its very own biased loop in decision making. How can a system be built to clean the actual information from the unwanted in digital platforms that are involved in real-time decision making.

Unlike that in the past, today, information is all over the place and itself has created an entangled jungle of information sources and destinations -  This is our new problem in the era of  advanced Artificial Intelligence (specially with tube videos and social media platforms very active) . How do one differentiate a real information with a shadowy one and make sure not to fall on the wrong side? Social aggregator platforms have already put up forces, however also falls in its very own biased loop in decision making. With the digital transformation personal data has become extremely vulnerable and requires 360 degree protection to individuals.

Today's educational Institutes are not yet ready in dealing with the next phase of problem solving and transformation. Incubation centres within the Institutes could be a fair initiative, however need a bonding agent and application systems that could make the universities 2025 ready. Incubation centres are not well equipped to host next generation entrepreneurs, yet.
AI Tool for generating an eye catching website design using voice and by analyzing answers to below 3 questions -i. Related websites, ii. Websites of your choice, iii. Preferred color scheme
Create a smart human-less Medicine Vending machine (All Time Medicine) have below options for ordering-i. Voice ordering,ii. Onscreen options, iii. Scanning prescription for remote assistance

Auto generate sign language interpretation from online training videos for aphasic people: Now a days internet is full of tutorial videos. But it is not same for aphasic or deaf people. They need the recorded videos to have sign language implemented for easy understanding.

Indoor GPS System for real time tracking of inventory. Inventory management will need to be automatic where stocks will be updated as they move in or out of the facility. Also it should be easy to know where the item is so that it can be located with a click of button.

An AI based model which will be trained on different parameters like blood sugar level, mental health status, any ongoing disease, smoking status, age, asthma, pressure etc and predict fatality rate. This can be integrated to online doctor consultation facililities, and then doctors can monitor patients with higher fatality rate with highest priority

In modern society, it has become lot difficult to track potholes across a region for a governing authority. That’s why most of the time they remain unrepaired just because they are not tracked. Build a system that would track and identify potholes in a region and will geotag them and then will store the information in a centralised database. There will be an application which will use the database and display region-wise potholes info like where they are and how many of those are there in a particular region. Local government bodies can use these information for a better and smart governing process and those can be repaired sooner.The process of identifying a pothole can be done in different processes, some of them are mentioned below- 1) there can be a iot device (hardware + software) which will be installed in vehicles so whenever those vehicles goes through roads having potholes they will detect them and geotag them and send the information to the database. The identification may be done by Image Segmentation processes or Deep Learning techniques., 2) Drone imaging may be used for the same. Here also identification may be done by Image Segmentation or DL., 3) Community Project: There can be selected users for this project (public contributors) who can use an app made for this project to manually submit their local pothole information with location data of the potholes. These are merely ideas which the team can take as a headstart. They can use whatever method they want, even their own methods. Also there has to be another application which the governing authority will use when they have repaired a pothole, to remove the pothole information from the centralised database or to update the status of it.

A system enabled with ML, which can identify users as per- i. their pre-filled data, ii. Their medicine order historyAnd flag the users with the disease pattern they have (suppose one person is ordering a diabatic medicine every month, so flag the patient as diabatic patient and so on). After flagging, the System should refer products and other medicines related to the disease to the user.

The class timetabling problem is a typical scheduling problem that appears to be a stressful job in every academic institute. In previous years, timetable scheduling was done manually with a single person or group of individuals involved in the task of scheduling it manually. Planning of timetable is one of the most complex and error-prone applications because it is actually done manually. This situation demands a comprehensive approach where a computer can be used to schedule a timetabling problem by being automated using a concept. In institutions, the class time table is a major administrative activity which is prerequisite. The time table problem or conflict can be said to be the problem of assigning a number of events into a limited number of time period. The problem of the time table is subject to many constraints which are usually divided into two categories: “hard” and “soft”. Hard Constraints: These are constraints that must be enforced. Some examples of such constraints are: 1. In each period, there should be sufficient resources (e.g. rooms and lecturers) available for all the events that have been scheduled for that time period. 2. No lecturer should have different classes at the same time slot. There cannot be more than two classes for a subject in one day. Soft Constraints: Soft constraints are those that are desirable but not absolutely essential. Sometimes it is impossible to satisfy all soft constraints in real world situations. Some of the soft constraints (in both exams and course timetabling) are: 3. Lecturers and students may prefer to have all their lectures in some number of days and to have a number of lecture-free days 4. Lab classes may not be in consecutive hours 5. Every staff should get at least one first hour 6. A particular class may need to be scheduled in a particular time period. Objectives The project is a software application that many Institutions, businesses and some companies may actually need. This is a simple case of an allocation problem. (1) The project involves developing a program that can schedule time table effectively for school. The prototype of this work should be followed by the development of a booking system that can automatically allocate resources. (2) The main principal of this project is to solve timetable problems with evolutionary computing processes.

pf.title: Step 1
pf.desc: Teams should be formed as per perspective guidelines. Eligibility of the members for SBH Junior and SBH Senior should follow eligibility guidelines.

pf.title: Step 2
pf.desc: A theme and matching problem statement has to be defined from SBH portal at sbh.rcciit.org.in.

pf.title: Step 3
pf.desc: IDEA template has to be prepared following the given IDEA template PPT in the SBH portal.

pf.title: Step 4
pf.desc: A PDF has to be created of this PPT.

pf.title: Step 5
pf.desc: A consent letter has to be obtained in the given format from the Head of the institute and it scould be scanned to PDF.

pf.title: Step 6
pf.desc: Registration form has to be filled with all of the above mentioned details at Google forms.

pf.title: Step 7
pf.desc: Idea selection and intimation to Mentors of selected teams for Grand Finale Registration.

pf.title: Step 8
pf.desc: Grand Finale Round at RCCIIT, Evaluation of Development in Phases.

pf.title: Step 9
pf.desc: Final compilation of Results and Announcement of Winners.

winning-guidelines.title: Hackathons are opportunities to quickly check the feasibility of any novel idea, hence projects developed during Hackathons are usually very crude and absolutely not ready for field implementation or deployment as working solutions. They require considerable work or development before implementation/deployment as reliable, dependable solutions.

Ideally, the duration for development and implementation of SBH winning project should be between 6 months to 1 year. However, the duration could be increased /decreased with the mutual consent of all the involved parties.

Once the Organizing committee of SBH shared the contact details of the winning teams with the concerned Problem Statement given agency, they are requested to directly initiate communication with the winning teams to discuss further development and implementation roadmap of the winning ideas.

Concerned Problem statement agency should request a detailed project plan from the winning team which should include implementation details, tools (software & hardware) required, expert support required along with timelines.
Concerned Problem statement agency should procure commercial Software/Hardware critical for the development and implementation of the winning project.
Ideally, a panel of experts may be appointed to oversee the development and deployment of the SBH-winning solution.
TMinimum one experienced technical expert per idea/winning solution should be assigned as a ‘mentor’ to ensure timely progress and implementation of the project.

In the majority of cases, the winning team will work remotely from their college, hence effective coordination is very critical. It is highly recommended that the RCCIIT schedule regular weekly/monthly monitoring sessions with each team through available video conferencing tools along with Concerned Problem statement agency.
If required, an appropriate faculty member from the same institution of the winning team may be co-opted as an additional ‘mentor’ for better coordination on project development.

Additionally, written consent from the winning team’s educational institution should be taken committing support (permissions and time commitments) during the development and deployment of the project. Educational institutions will not have any financial burden in this regard.
In the case of software solutions, a cybersecurity expert may be engaged to ensure that the development of the winning solution is on par with the required safety standards.
In the case of a hardware-based product, then it is highly recommended that a ‘Product Design Expert’ may be regularly consulted to ensure state of an art product.
Concerned Problem statement agency will share quarterly status reports regarding the implementation and development of SBH-winning solutions with the RCCIIT.
